sources.title: Waterloo Road
sources.description: Title: Waterloo Road Summary: A drama set during World War II. A tale of adultery and desertion. Directed by: Sidney Gilliat Actors: John Mills, Stewart Granger, Alastair Sim Production Company: Gainsborough Pictures Release Date: 5 February 1945 (UK) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 During World War II, an Army Private hears rumors that his wife in London is becoming sweet on a smooth operator who has avoided being called up. The serviceman takes leave without permission to get to his house near Waterloo station to find out what's going on.

sources.title: Waterloo Road
sources.description: “British wartime gem” “Enjoyable and underrated” “True to life” “Witty script” “Wonderful little film” “Well crafted and a must-see” (IMDB reviews quotes). A drama of love, the stress of separation and temptation in wartime London. Tight direction and good production values raises it well above the average for most second features. Its excellent cast includes John Mills, Stewart Granger and Alastair Sim. IMDB rating 6.7. Directer by Sidney Gilliat. UK release 1945. US release 1948. Complete print (PAL transfer).

metadata.Plot: During World War II, an Army Private hears rumors that his wife in London is becoming sweet on a smooth operator who has avoided being called up. The serviceman takes leave without permission to get to his house near Waterloo station to find out what's going on.
metadata.Actors: John Mills, Stewart Granger, Alastair Sim
